09:00 am

"The objective to reach a democratic agreement was very straightforward. Only pacific political dialogue was sought"

12:00 pm

"By forgetting too briskly, mistakes are never learned. The previous steps from that day need to be looked back on, retraced, and reflected upon. Only then, can history be stopped from repeating itself again"

03:OO pm.

"There were two options for the movement to go: continue accepting the government's impunity and transgressions, which would lead nowhere, or stand up for ideals that would move the nation forward"

05:55 PM.

"Helicopters appeared out of nowhere... Two flares fell down from the sky... gunshots were heard... There was panic everywhere... hopes and dreams were scattered in many directions... only one purpose... escape and survive"

06:00pm.

"First, the inmediate buildings were attacked. Soon after, military groups blocked two of the south streets, and finally, the west square was seized, forcing a last flee attempt towards the north. After a couple of dozen of minutes, only silence remained...

The End

Following a summer of increasingly large demonstrations protesting the 1968 Olympics held in Mexico City, the Mexican Armed Forces opened fire on October 2, 1968, on unarmed students and other bystanders, killing an undetermined number, in the hundreds. It occurred in the "Plaza de las Tres Culturas" in the Tlatelolco section of Mexico City. The events (known as the "Tlatelolco massacre") are considered part of the Mexican Dirty War, when the US-backed Institutional Revolutionary Party(PRI) regime, violently repressed political and social opposition. The slaugther occurred 10 days before the Olympics' opening ceremony. 50+ years later, the pain still lingers...
Memory is stronger than oblivion...
